conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, angled/isometric perspective, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness and readable volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplifications at some corners/openings reduce perfect geometric fidelity.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (dining top-left, kitchen top, living right, bedroom left, small wash/toilet core, stair zone). Some proportional drift and a few wall/door placements (notably entry/stair relationship) appear shifted versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and placed in the correct functional rooms (dining table/chairs, sofa+coffee table, bed, kitchen counters/appliances, toilet/sink). Scales and orientations are generally reasonable.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good contrast between walls/floors and openings; interior is easily readable. No label/UI clutter; minimal artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Some layout/proportion discrepancies: the stair/entry zone and a few partition alignments appear offset compared to the 2D plan.
Door/opening placements are simplified; a few door/window positions/sizes do not precisely match the 2D plan.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway with strong spatial readability and mostly faithful room layout, with moderate proportional and opening-placement deviations from the 2D plan.
